question: 残品
sourceMnemonic:
The <kanji>remainder</kanji> <kanji>product</kanji>s are the things that haven't been sold. They're the <vocabulary>unsold merchandise</vocabulary>. They're the <vocabulary>remaining stock</vocabulary>.

This is a very specific word that is mainly used in the context of inventory management or retail sales.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Note that <ja>ひん</ja> changes to <ja>ぴん</ja>.
